page.title: 12Farming
page.content:
When you drive up the Grizedale or Dale Park valleys you can see {forest}on both sides, and lower down there are{grass fields}which are walled, hedged or fenced off. Some of the fields will have cows or sheep grazing, but others are left for hay and silage. The{buildings}are made of Lakeland slate, but some have been rendered or pebbledashed.
The farms sell their{milk}to the Milk Marketing Board which allocates some of it for{butter}and{cheese} making or just leaves it as milk. Some cows are slaughtered for{beef,}while the sheep and the lambs are sold for mutton and lamb chops. The sheep's wool is bought by the British Wool Marketing Board to be made into cloth and knitting wool.
